title: Mayan ruins, Côte d’Azur, dogs on cruises
text:
Med calm: Olivette harbour, Cap d’Antibes (Valery Trillaud/Getty) I’m going to the Riviera Maya, in Mexico, next month for a little winter sun, but I’d also like to see some Mayan architecture. Tulum and Coba are within reasonable driving distance of my hotel — which is more interesting?
James Harris, St Albans
Alessia Horwich replies
No question, it’s Coba. The site at Tulum is small and crawling with tourists, the structures are in bad shape and you’ll find little information about the site’s history, unless you hire a guide. The main reason to go there is to swim in the shadow of the temples, but if the weather is stormy, access to the beach is closed and you won’t even get to do that.
